Description: Lip sherd of Laconian, probably black-figured, pottery kylix; dull cream slip on exterior; interior glazed black except for narrow reserved bands top and bottom; exterior: black band (partly flaked off) at lip above two lines; reserved below; inscription on exterior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ7
Curator's comments: Marked in pencil on outside 'Φ7' and 'belongs to 88 6-1 52.' (the last figure worn); but there is no possible sherd that could be relevant in the series
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B7.3)
Stibbe 1972 / Lakonische Vasenmaler des sechsten Jahrhunderts v. Chr. (p. 278, no. 179)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 554, no. E20)
Venit 1985 / Laconian Black Figure Pottery in Egypt (p. 396, no. 20)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 240, no. 20)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GC.03) (Phase 1)
